intro: Chimaerochloa archboldii, commonly known as the Archbold's chamaecorn, is a rare grass species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, blade-like leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats, often in forest understories. It has small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
